intro: Pimpinella longiradiata, commonly known as the long-rayed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
